meanings.definition: The state or quality of being clamorous.
meanings.sent1: The clamorousnesses of the children playing outside could be heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The clamorousnesses of the protesters outside the government building made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The clamorousnesses of the birds chirping in the morning added a lively touch to the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The clamorousnesses of the thunderstorm echoed through the valley, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: The clamorousnesses of the market vendors calling out their prices created a bustling and energetic scene.

meanings.definition: The loud and insistent noise or outcry of a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The clamorousnesses of the fans cheering for their team filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The clamorousnesses of the crowd demanding justice could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent3: The clamorousnesses of the children arguing over toys in the playground was both amusing and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The clamorousnesses of the wind howling through the trees sounded like a chorus of voices in the night.
meanings.sent5: The clamorousnesses of the students protesting for climate action reverberated through the city streets.
